articles.title: Study documents devastating effects of Long COVID two years after infection - WSWS
articles.description: The study’s implications are staggering, as it finds that long past infection, people remain at risk for a broad array of serious, life-threatening health events impacting over half their body systems.
articles.content: A study recently published in Nature Medicine comprehensively assessed for the first time a broad range of impacts of COVID-19 up to two years after SARS-CoV-2 infection. It found that of 80 long-ter… [+11583 chars]

articles.title: Even relatively low levels of physical activity are linked to lower depression risk in older adults - PsyPost
articles.description: New research published in JAMA Network Open suggests that engaging in as little as 100 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity weekly, such as brisk walking, can significantly reduce the risk of depressive symptoms and the likelihood of major depressi…
articles.content: As little as 100 minutes per week of moderate-intensity physical activity, such as brisk walking, may be sufficient to significantly lower the risk of depressive symptoms and odds of major depression… [+6578 chars]
